results.title: Clara [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Film Camp, Film Victoria, Philippa Campey and Van Sowerine
results.brief_description: An expressive although wordless evocation of a child’s grief, “Clara” uses silicone models and stop motion animation to portray a young girl’s reactions to the death of someone close. (Awards: Chicago International Film festival 2005, Best Animated Film, Cannes Film Festival 2005, Special Mention Best Short Film category)

results.title: Claire of the moon
results.creator_credit: Demi-Monde Productions, Pam Kuri and Nicole Conn
results.brief_description: Two successful writers—a promiscuous heterosexual novelist and a brooding lesbian sex therapist—are assigned a cabin together on a writer’s retreat for women. The two women are total opposites and argue constantly about their different philosophical and sexual orientations. Yet underlying their animosity is a growing sexual tension which, after much angst and rhetoric is finally consummated. Overly earnest in its intellectual attempts to explore female sexuality, “Claire of the moon” fails to engage the viewer on an emotional level. The long-awaited ‘climatic’ sex scene at the film’s conclusion only partially makes up for the tiresome talk-fest that precedes it. Cast includes Trisha Todd and Karen Trumbo.

results.title: Clair de Terre = Earth Light
results.brief_description:
Pierre lives alone with his father in Le Marais district of Paris. He constantly thinks of Tunisia where his mother died when he was only five years old. He finally manages to travel accross to the country of his birth and meets Madame Lariviere, a former friend of the family.

Credits: Director, Guy Gilles ; writers, Guy Gilles ; photography, Guy Gilles, Philippe Rousselot ; music, Jean-Pierre Stora.
Cast: Edwige Feuillere, Annie Girardot, Patrick Jouanne, Roger Hanin, Micheline Presle, Elina Labourdette.

results.title: Clair de Femme = Woman Light
results.brief_description:
Michel is running away from home and his dying wife. While wandering aimlesslely, he meets Lydia who is still grieving the loss of her husband and child. For a whole night these two desperate characters are walking the streets of Paris, visiting bars and cabarets, and meeting equally strange, emotionally displaced people.

Credits: Producer, Georges-Alain Vuille ; director, Costa-Gavras ; writer, Costa-Gavras ; photography, Ricardo Aronovich ; music, Jean Musy.
Cast: Yves Montand, Romy Schneider, Romolo Valli, Lila Kedrova, Heinz Bennent, Roberto Benigni, Francois Perrot, Daniel Mesguich, Catherine Allegret, Dieter Schidor.

results.title: Civil War and reconstruction: 1861-1877
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, Milton Meltzer and Alvin Yudkoff
results.brief_description: Shows the election of Abraham Lincoln, the establishment of the Confederacy, Civil War, and the problems of reconstruction. Includes the role of African Americans in the Civil War after the emancipation proclamation and the terror in the South following the war. Also includes education of African Americans and activities of the Ku Klux Klan.

results.title: Civil rights movement: Mississippi Summer Project
results.brief_description: Depicts the Civil Rights movement and the Summer Project of 1963 in a single community in Mississippi and highlights vital issues, such as the freedom schools set up by volunteers, labour exploitation, police brutality, voter registration and the challenge of achieving racial peace. Edited from the Richard Beymer presentation - “A Regular bouquet”.

results.title: Cityscape: impressions of a city
results.brief_description: An experiment, from NFB’s animation workshop, in creating continuous metamorphoses on the screen, employing charcoal drawings on a white board in a process of erasing, adding, photographing. In this film there is the impression of a succession of creatures moving across the screen, then disappearing into a hole. Eventually the hole changes to a bridge on which stands the youth who began the parade. Animation by Ryan Larkin. (Award: San Francisco)

results.title: City water supply
results.brief_description: Illustrates the relation between rainfall and life. The sources of a city’s water supply - wells, rivers, lakes and watersheds - are also illustrated and the film goes on to study both the varied methods which are employed to distribute water throughout a city, and the methods used to prevent the spread of disease and epidemics through water-borne bacteria.

results.title: City under pressure
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Frank Spiller and Theodore Conant
results.brief_description: A case study of municipal government and the influence of citizens acting as a group. The study is of Edmonton, Canada, but the problems shown are common to many cities - urban renewal, traffic congestion, zoning etc. Listens in on discussion of these questions in Edmonton to provide ground for further discussion by the audience.
